title: Ticket #1094: MAX_.._LOG limit not strictly honored
description:
The footer written to a log file before rotation causes the log to grow past its MAX. 

$ time dd if=/dev/zero of=ShadowLog bs=42966 count=49981
49981+0 records in
49981+0 records out
2147483646 bytes (2.1 GB) copied, 75.9196 s, 28.3 MB/s
dd if=/dev/zero of=ShadowLog bs=42966 count=49981  0.03s user 8.06s system 10% cpu 1:15.92 total
$ _CONDOR_SHADOW_LOG=$PWD/ShadowLog _CONDOR_MAX_SHADOW_LOG=2147483647 _CONDOR_SHADOW_LOCK=$PWD/ShadowLog condor_shadow
$ ls -l ShadowLog*
-rw-r--r--. 1 matt matt        964 2010-01-08 09:34 ShadowLog
-rw-------. 1 matt matt 2147483794 2010-01-08 09:34 ShadowLog.old
$ tail -n2 ShadowLog.old
MaxLog = 2147483647, length = 0
Saving log file to "/home/matt/ShadowLog.old"

And the length is wrong, it wrapped.
